alert.note: Alert for Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 2:45PM MST until February 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills ongoing. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Julesburg, and Holyoke. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 9 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions due to snow and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
